head.title: Meow
head.intro: [meow](https://npmjs.com/package/meow) is the easiest way to write command line apps for Node.js.

body.title: Typical settings
body.elms:
```js
const cli = require('cs/meow')(`
  Usage: appname [options]

  Options:
        --lang LANG    set the language

  Other options:
    -h, --help         show usage information
    -v, --version      print version info and exit
`, {
  string: ['lang'],
  boolean: ['help', 'version'],
  alias: { h: 'help', v: 'version' }
})
```

`string` and `boolean` lets meow/minimist know which flags expect arguments (`string`) and which don't (`boolean`).

body.title: Using the result
body.elms:
```js
cli.flags   // { lang: 'en' }
cli.input   // []
```

Yes, flags are automatically camelCased!
